p: In Papua New Guinea folk medicine, the extract of the leaves of P. aduncum is used to treat insect bites, dressing sores and cuts, and scabies whereas the extract of the barks is used for the treatment of toothache, diarrhea, dysentery, scabies, cuts, cough and fungal infections. Moreover, the roots are used to treat stomach and respiratory ailments, skin wounds and dysentery; while extracts of the stem and fruits are used for treating headache and toothache, respectively [ 17]. In the traditional medicine of Indonesia, P. aduncum is used to treat burns [ 17].
